title: Therapeutic Island Disease Rescue: Alternative Prediction Strategy
summary: Therapeutic islands fail because of low drug-sharing with kNN neighbors, NOT drug uniqueness. All 9 islands are 75-100% self-referential. Alternative signals (TransE, gene overlap, drug class) cannot generate NEW predictions — they only annotate existing kNN predictions. No actionable rescue within current architecture.

islands.failure_mode: hierarchy+ATC rules work but kNN is blind
disease-specific antivirals not in kNN pool
different treatment paradigm than general hypertension
triptans/CGRPs not in kNN neighbor pool
base_to_complication filter + acute vs chronic distinction
antiparasitic drugs unique to few diseases

key_findings.drug_sharing_not_the_problem: All 9 diseases have 67-100% of GT drugs shared with other diseases. Drugs ARE in the system.
key_findings.neighbor_mismatch_IS_the_problem: kNN neighbors have mean GT overlap of only 0.3-7.2 drugs (vs 6.2-22.6 for high performers). Nearby diseases use different drugs.
key_findings.embedding_similarity_is_fine: Islands have mean neighbor similarity 0.498-0.791 (vs 0.412-0.775 for high performers). The embeddings are fine.
key_findings.alternative_signals_dont_help: TransE 0%, gene overlap circular with kNN, drug class already exploited. No new signal available.
key_findings.self_referentiality_confirmed: All 9 islands are 75-100% self-referential. Predictions vanish entirely when disease is held out.
key_findings.system_still_works_via_rules: ADHD has 18 MEDIUM+ predictions, PAH has 11 HIGH predictions — from hierarchy/ATC rules, not kNN.
key_findings.holdout_underestimates_quality: 0% holdout is misleading — PAH has 11 correct HIGH predictions. Holdout penalizes self-referential diseases.

implications: Therapeutic islands require NON-kNN prediction strategy (literature mining, clinical trial data)
Current architecture structurally cannot rescue these diseases
Holdout metric is not appropriate for self-referential diseases — need alternative quality measure
Drug class expansion (e.g., all triptans for migraine) could help but requires new data infrastructure
Island annotation in deliverable is the best current approach (already implemented)
